Former Beatles drummer Ringo Starr he appears in the film "That

Former Beatles drummer Ringo Starr he appears in the film " That ll Be The Day", being shot at Warners Holiday Camp in Ryde on the Isle of Wight.

Here he is pictured with co-star David Essex.

24th October 1972

Arthur Sidey

Daily Mirror

Mirrorpix

England

72 10181

EDITORS COMMENTS

In this print from 1972, we catch a glimpse of former Beatles drummer Ringo Starr as he takes on the world of film. The image captures him during the shooting of "That'll Be The Day" at Warners Holiday Camp in Ryde on the Isle of Wight. Standing beside him is his co-star David Essex, both exuding an undeniable aura of talent and charisma. As one of the most iconic figures in music history, Ringo Starr's foray into acting was met with great anticipation and excitement. This particular moment frozen in time showcases his transition from being a renowned musician to exploring new avenues within the entertainment industry. The year 1972 marked a significant era for pop culture, and this photograph encapsulates that spirit perfectly. With their stylish attire and unmistakable charm, Ringo Starr and David Essex epitomize the essence of 1970s fashion and music scene. Photographer Arthur Sidey has masterfully captured this historic moment, allowing us to relive a pivotal chapter in both Ringo Starr's career and popular culture as a whole. As we gaze upon this image, we are transported back to a time when music legends ventured beyond their comfort zones to leave an indelible mark on various artistic mediums. This stunning print serves as a testament to the enduring legacy left by these influential musicians-turned-actors – forever etching their names not only in musical history but also within cinematic realms.
